recipe.ingredients: - olive oil: 1 tablespoon - onion (chopped): 1 medium - garlic (minced): 2 cloves - carrots (sliced): 2 - zucchini (sliced): 1 large - green beans (chopped): 1 cup - celery (sliced): 2 stalks - low-sodium vegetable broth: 4 cups - canned diced tomatoes (no salt added): 1 can (14.5 ounces) - thyme (dried): 1 teaspoon - black pepper: 1/2 teaspoon - spinach (chopped): 1 cup
recipe.directions: 1. Saut√© Vegetables: In a large pot, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add onions and garlic, and cook until onions are translucent. 2. Add Vegetables: Stir in carrots, zucchini, green beans, and celery. Cook for about 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. 3. Add Liquids and Season: Pour in the low-sodium vegetable broth and diced tomatoes. Season with thyme and black pepper. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for about 20 minutes. 4. Add Greens: Stir in spinach during the last 5 minutes of cooking. 5. Serve: Serve hot. Optionally, you can garnish with fresh herbs like parsley or basil before serving.
recipe.nutrition: Total Carbohydrate: 18g, Dietary Fiber: 4g, Sodium: 70mg, Saturated Fat: 0.5g, Total Fat: 3.5g, Protein: 3g, Added Sugars: 0g, Total Sugars: 9g
recipe.total_calories_estimation: - Total Calories for entire recipe : Approximately 255 calories for the entire recipe. - Calories for each ingredient: Olive Oil: 119 calories per tablespoon Onion: 45 calories Garlic: 9 calories Carrots: 50 calories for two carrots Zucchini: 33 calories Green Beans: 34 calories per cup Celery: 12 calories for two stalks Vegetable Broth: 17 calories for 4 cups Diced Tomatoes: 41 calories per can Spinach: 7 calories per cup - Serving People: 4
